abstract: The British oil company said it planned to sell more assets and increase investment in exploration as it rebounds from the 2010 oil spill disaster.
snippet: The British oil company said it planned to sell more assets and increase investment in exploration as it rebounds from the 2010 oil spill disaster.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The British oil company BP said Tuesday that its earnings fell 3.7 percent in the third quarter as production declined. The company also said it planned to sell more assets.

headline.main: BP Earnings Slip 3.7% on Lower Production
headline.print_headline: BP Plans to Sell More Assets, as Earnings Fall on Lower Production
